interfaces.kernel

Interface JCL_IoTfacade


  • public interface JCL_IoTfacade
    Version:
    1.0 This class represents a JCL facade for IoT requirements. There are facades for HPC demands and for capacity planning. For JCL an IoT device indicates a sensing device. IMPORTANT: JCL requires the configuration of each Host in a cluster or grid. The Host can be a HPC device (laptops, desktops, workstations and servers) or an IoT device (arduino) or a hybrid device (smartphones and Linux based boards with sensing and HPC features, like multiple cores and gpu cards). See JCL installation guide and programming guide for more details.
    Author:
    JCL team

    • Field Summary

        get a list of registered IoT Devices with the number of cores. Each entry of the map corresponds to an IoT device with its number of cores
        Returns:
        a Map with host as key and number of cores as value

      • getSensingData

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,JCL_Sensor> getSensingData(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> deviceNickname,
                                                           java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sensorNickname)
        retrieves the last 10 collected data of a sensor, regardless the data are obtained from a context event or periodically
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - The device which the sensor is configured
        sensorNickname - The sensor to collect the sensing data
        Returns:
        a Map with the last 10 collected data of the sensor

      • getAllSensingData

        java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,JCL_Sensor> getAllSensingData(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> deviceNickname,
                                                              java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sensorNickname)
        retrieves all collected data of a sensor. Note that, each sensor in JCL has a limit support to retrieve data. Each sensor has a limit in MBytes. JCL cleans automatically the old data to avoid garbage.
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - The device which the sensor is configured
        sensorNickname - The sensor to collect the sensing data
        Returns:
        a Map with all the sensing data of all the sensors of an IoT device

      • getLastSensingData

        java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.Integer,JCL_Sensor> getLastSensingData(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> deviceNickname,
                                                                     java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sensorNickname)
        retrieves the last collected data of a specific sensor
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - The device which the sensor is configured
        sensorNickname - The sensor to collect the last sensing data
        Returns:
        the last sensing data of the sensor

        allows active sensing, collecting the sensing data at the given moment
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - The device where the active sensing will occur
        sensorNickname - The sensor where the data will be retrieved
        Returns:

      • turnOn

        boolean turnOn(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> deviceNickname)
        the device is turned on. When the device is turned off, it is a logical operation only, so the device still receives commands. Sensing and processing and storage are prohibitive during the off state. The developer cannot obtain sensing data from off devices. He must turn them on first.
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - The device to turn on
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the device was turned on or not

      • standBy

        boolean standBy(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> deviceNickname)
        puts the device in an standby mode. In this mode the device stops sensing, processing and storage. Control commands, like turn on, are accepted
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - The device to put on standby mode
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the device was put on standby mode

      • setSensorMetadata

        boolean setSensorMetadata(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> deviceNickname,
                          java.lang.String sensorAlias,
                          int sensorId,
                          int sensorSize,
                          int sensorSampling,
                          java.lang.String inputOrOutput,
                          int type)
        allows the configuration of a sensor of device and programmatically
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - The device where the sensor will be configured
        sensorAlias - An alias for the sensor
        sensorId - The pin where the sensor will be configured
        sensorSize - Indicates the maximum size in MB, which will be used to store the collected sensor data
        sensorSampling - Indicates the interval to collect sensor data, performing the passive sensing periodically
        inputOrOutput - An String indicating the type of the sensor ("input" for sensing and "output" for acting)
        type - A Integer representing the sensor/actuator type (0 - Generic, 1 - Servo)
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the sensor was configured

      • removeSensor

        boolean removeSensor(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> deviceNickname,
                     java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sensorNickname)
        removes a previously configured sensor from a device. No more commands are allowed to such a device. JCL removes it from its cluster or grid.
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - The device where the sensor is configured
        sensorNickname - The sensor to remove
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the sensor was removed

      • acting

        boolean acting(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> deviceNickname,
               java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> actuatorNickname,
               java.lang.Object[] commands)
        executes a sequence of commands on an actuator
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - The device where the actuator is configured
        actuatorNickname - The actuator where the commands will be executed
        commands - a sequence of commands
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the action was done

      • setConfig

        boolean setConfig(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> deviceNickname,
                  implementations.dm_kernel.IoTuser.JCL_Configuration configuration)
        configure a device according to an configuration instance. The configuration instance is the in memory representation of the configuration file used for each JCL component (User, Server, Super-peer and Host)
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - the Device to set the configuration
        configuration - the configuration to be deployed in the device
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating if the configuration was loaded

                      boolean encryption)
        enables or disables the encryption on a device
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - The device to define the encryption
        encryption - Indicates if the encryption will be enabled or disabled
        Returns:

      • registerContext

        boolean registerContext(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> deviceNickname,
                        java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sensorNickname,
                        implementations.dm_kernel.IoTuser.JCL_Expression expression,
                        java.lang.String contextNickname)
        register a context on a device
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - The device where the context will be registered
        sensorNickname - The sensor which value will be used to trigger the context
        expression - An JCL_Expression to indicate the conditions to trigger the context
        contextNickname - A nickname for the context
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the context was set

      • addContextAction

        java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result> addContextAction(java.lang.String contextNickname,
                                                         boolean useSensorValue,
                                                         java.lang.String classNickname,
                                                         java.lang.String methodName,
                                                         java.lang.Object... args)
        adds a task to be executed when a certain context is reached
        Parameters:
        contextNickname - The context nickname
        useSensorValue - Indicates if the sensor value will be used in the task
        classNickname - Class name defined by the developer in register phase. #register(Class, String) #register(File[], String)
        methodName - The class method name to be executed.
        args - The method parameters
        Returns:
        a Long indicating a ticket to get the result of the task

      • addContextAction

        boolean addContextAction(java.lang.String contextNickname,
                         java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> deviceNickname,
                         java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> actuatorNickname,
                         java.lang.Object[] commands)
        adds a acting command to an actuator when a certain context is reached
        Parameters:
        contextNickname - The context nickname
        deviceNickname - The device where the actuator is configured
        actuatorNickname - The actuator where the commands will be executed
        commands - a sequence of commands
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the action was done

      • removeContextResult

        boolean removeContextResult(java.lang.String contextNickname,
                            java.util.concurrent.Future<JCL_result> ticket)
        remove the result of the task if the context already was reached.
        Parameters:
        contextNickname - The context nickname
        ticket - the ID of the task
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the result was removed

      • registerMQTTContext

        boolean registerMQTTContext(java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> deviceNickname,
                            java.util.Map.Entry<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sensorNickname,
                            implementations.dm_kernel.IoTuser.JCL_Expression expression,
                            java.lang.String topicName)
        register a new MQTT Context using the name specified as the topic name. Data is published on this topic only when the specified expression is true
        Parameters:
        deviceNickname - The device where the context will be registered
        sensorNickname - The sensor which value will be used to trigger the context
        expression - An JCL_Expression to indicate the conditions to trigger the context
        topicName - the topic nickname
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the context was set

      • unregisterMQTTContext

        unregister a previously registered MQTT context
        Parameters:
        topicName - The nickname of the topic that will be unregistered
        Returns:
        a boolean indicating whether the context was unregistered
